FREELANCE PRODUCTION MANAGER - MEN'S & WOMEN'S WOVENS/KNITS

SUMMARY

Creative Development and Production Manager with a strong background in Men's and Women's Wovens, Denim, Knits, and Graphics.
Passion to expand upon current skill sets and areas of expertise.
Sets and maintains high personal and professional standards.
Creative strategic thinker; strong ability to quickly identify, analyze, and resolve challenges to achieve the most effective outcome.
Highlights
Fabric and trim vendor relations Strong cost negotiation skills Superior communication skills WebPDM and PLM
Extensive print knowledge Wash development Apparel construction Experienced in traveling to Asia factories

<JD_START>
Job Title: Continuous Improvement Manager

Location: Lithia Springs, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Founded in 2013, Home Chef is the leading meal solutions company with both a retail and online presence. Available online at homechef.com and in retail at more than 2,100 Kroger grocery stores, Home Chef is committed to inspiring and enabling more people to cook simple, delicious meals, no matter how busy they are.

Similar to our recipes, we recognize that variety is the spice of life, and therefore, our employees also bring their uniqueness and color to our fantastic team. We’re eager to work with humble team players and pragmatic next-level thinkers to innovate on Home Chef’s offerings.

Overview

We are looking for an exceptional people leader who can coach our plant employees to create a vision for lean operations and drive lasting, impactful change at our production facilities. We are seeking a no-nonsense, hands-on leader to enable systematic improvements in all areas of fulfillment, from light assembly and inventory management, to implementing enterprise-wide technology (e.g., WMS). The ideal candidate will be able to lead insightful, rapid problem-solving to unlock value; he or she will be equally comfortable to see through tactical change on the shop floor and in the warehouse. This role is a unique opportunity to put his/her mark on driving best-in-class lean operational practices and build a high-skill, impact-led team at a fast-paced start-up.

Distinctive performers will have ample opportunities to grow and progress quickly in our rapidly expanding operations organization. The Continuous Improvement Manager reports directly to the fulfillment center’s plant manager and is based in Lithonia, GA. We invest heavily in our people at Home Chef, and we are looking for leaders who are effective and efficient managers, but also role models and mentors.

Responsibilities

 Lead site CI Initiatives 

 Develop a plan for continuous improvement across all plant functions; prioritize initiatives through impact and feasibility in partnership with department leaders , corporate resources, peers at the other fulfillment centers, and the plant manager.  Identify needs and opportunities for greater efficiency and effectiveness in the end-to-end fulfillment process through on-site observation and cross-functional brainstorming sessions  Support initiatives tied to clear financial and operational targets  Drive impactful, lasting change through continuous improvement initiatives by working alongside managers, team leads and hourly associates  Reinforcing best-practices and SOPs through day-to-day coaching and training in core business processes (e.g., production planning, ingredient portioning, labor scheduling)  Advocate for initiatives and present business results in plant management meetings. 


 Participate in HC Network CI planning and execution 

 Collaborate closely to implement initiatives with operations technology, procurement, food safety & quality, operations analytics, HR and, most importantly, plant fulfillment  Act as a partner to share best practices across facilities, with the aim of building a unified “One Home Chef” approach to fulfillment  Report out metrics and improvement initiatives to National CI team  Participate in network Kaizen events and act as site lead 


 Site Operational Excellence Program liaison and Management Systems Pillar Lead 

 Create schedule for operational excellence audits in partnership with site and National CI team  Work with site and National CI team to prioritize and implement Management Systems best practices in accordance with the Home Chef Operational Excellence program 


Qualifications

 Completion of a four-year degree program in a related field  Y ou are an amazing leader who creates energy, lives integrity, leads change, creates a vision, and inspires people to achieve goals, in a fast-paced, high-urgency Customer-First environment.  You are impact-driven first and foremost; you live and breathe performance management through KPIs, and your passion is to make change stick in partnership with the plant managers, department leaders, and employees.  You have a proven track record of achievement in change management and lean operations, through day-to-day coaching, instilling new practices and tools, and building enthusiasm to reach stretch targets (1-2 years’ experience in lean/six sigma preferred).  You have a strong interest in the meal kit industry and a passion for delivering the best possible products to our consumers.  You ideally have experience driving complex initiatives with multiple stakeholders across functions in a fast-paced environment.  You are extremely comfortable in a plant environment, in refrigerated conditions below 40 degrees. 


More About Us

Perks and benefits:

 Candidates can experience Home Chef as a customer - enter promo code PEOPLE30 for $30 off your first order!  Medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance available  Paid holidays, sick time and vacation time  401k program  Flexible spending accounts for qualified medical, dependent care, parking, or transit expenses 


How We Work Together

We are humble team players.

We are warm and gracious with team members and customers. We seek feedback to improve ourselves - and respectfully listen to and accept input.

We are pragmatic next-level thinkers.

We come up with novel and unique ideas. We explore new strategies to avoid being constrained by conventional thinking.

We take ownership.

We approach ambiguous problems, prepared to dive in, get curious, and learn more. We are results-driven, always challenging ourselves to exceed goals.

Be at Home at Home Chef

We all show up authentically at Home Chef. Our team includes individuals with a variety of identities, backgrounds, and perspectives. You can trust that you’ll be able to bring your whole self to an inclusive and enjoyable workplace.

We welcome people of all races, colors, religions, national origin or ancestry, sex (including sexual identity), age, physical or mental disabilities, pregnancy, veteran or military status, unfavorable discharge from military service, genetic information, sexual orientation, marital status, order of protection status, citizenship status, arrest record or expunged/sealed convictions, or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local law.

Home Chef is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Home Chef will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact our People team at hr@homechef.com .

Home Chef is an equal opportunity employer.

To view the California Applicant Notice click here

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
